```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library('ggplot2')
```


```{r}
researchData = read.table("dataset.txt", header=T, sep="")

plot(x=researchData$StepLimit, y=log(researchData$TotalError))

ggplot(researchData, aes(x=StepLimit, y=FailedCases, color=factor(Generalized))) + geom_point(alpha=0.1)

ggplot(researchData, aes(x=StepLimit, y=FailedCases, group=factor(RunNumber))) + geom_line(alpha=0.1)
```

Let's add a new column that is true if `FailedCases = FailedByStepLimit`:

```{r}
researchData$AllFailuresOutOfSteps = (researchData$FailedCases == researchData$FailedByStepLimit)

equalFailures = subset(researchData, researchData$AllFailuresOutOfSteps)

nrow(equalFailures)

ggplot(equalFailures, aes(x=StepLimit, y=FailedCases, group=factor(RunNumber), color=factor(RunNumber))) + geom_line(alpha=0.5, show.legend=FALSE)
```
